meaningMnemonic: Remember how you learned that 大人 means "adult?" Well this is the adjective version of that. The I-adjective (see how it ends in い?). What adjective do adults want to be able to use for their own kids? They want to say they are <vocabulary>obedient</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>quiet</vocabulary> kids!
readingMnemonic: You already learned this reading when you learned 大人! You should be able to read this too!
